definitions.definition: a small, round, or oval object produced by a plant and from which, when it is planted, a new plant can grow:
examples: Sow the seeds (= put them in the ground) about three centimetres deep.

definitions.definition: If a food plant goes or runs to seed, it produces flowers and seeds because it has not been picked early enough:
examples: In hot weather lettuces can suddenly run to seed.

definitions.definition: If a person or place goes or runs to seed, their physical appearance becomes worse because no one takes care of them:
examples: After he retired, he really went to seed.
The plants have seeded themselves (= their seeds have fallen) into the cracks between the paving stones.

definitions.definition: to remove the seeds from a fruit or vegetable:
examples: Wash, seed, and cut the pepper into small pieces.
